meanings.definition: To unwind or separate twisted strands
meanings.sent1: She carefully untwines the yarn to fix the tangle.
meanings.sent2: He slowly untwines the rope to free the knot.
meanings.sent3: The cat untwines itself from the ball of yarn, looking confused.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing voice untwines the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze untwines the leaves from the branches.

meanings.definition: To disentangle or unravel twisted material
meanings.sent1: The magician untwines the colorful scarves in his act.
meanings.sent2: It takes patience to untwines the wires without damaging them.
meanings.sent3: The detective untwines the mystery, revealing the culprit.
meanings.sent4: Her smile untwines the worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight untwines the shadows cast by the trees.
